stems.BSC: (to be) a planet/planetary body; to travel one's orbit in space as a planet
stems.CTE: (to be) a world [i.e., the planetary home of a holistic eco-system/biosphere, etc.]
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical planetary body
stems.OBJ: (to be) the orbit(al path) of a planetary body; to orbit

stems: (to be) a moon of planetary body [i.e., sufficiently large to be spherical in shape]; to travel one's orbit in space as a moon/satellite of a planet
(to be) a large (spherical) asteroid or micro-planet

stems.BSC: (to be) the Earth/Terra (as both a planetary body and a 'world' encompassing a particular biosphere/ecosystem and civilization)
stems.CTE: (to be) 'the world' [i.e., the Terran-based biosphere, ecosystem, environment and civilizaton which Terran life inhabits]
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical planetary body itself that constitutes the planet Earth/Terra
stems.OBJ: (to be) the orbit(al path) of the planet Earth/Terra

stems: (to be) one of the named asteroids or micro-planets of the solar system (e.g., Pluto, Ceres, Juno, Sedna, etc.)

stems.BSC: (to be) a stellar body / star
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of a star shining
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical body/mass of a star
stems.OBJ: (to be) the location in space of a star (relative to other astral bodies)

refers: THE SUN (SOL) / NAMED COMET / NAMED PLANETESIMAL or ASTEROID

stems.BSC: (to be) the Sun / Sol
stems.CTE: (to be) the functional (shining) state of the Sun/Sol; for there to be sunshine, (for the Sun) to shine
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical body/mass of the Sun/Sol
stems.OBJ: (to be) the location in space of the Sun/Sol relative to other astral bodies

stems: (to be) a named small asteroid/planetesimal (e.g., Eros)

stems.BSC: (to be) a gas-based emission-type nebula or volume of nebulosity in interstellar space (i.e. cloud in space of of high-temperature and/or ionized gas, e.g., an H II region or Herbig-Haro object)
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of a gaseousness/nebulosity in a gas-based nebula
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical body/mass constituting a gas-based nebula
stems.OBJ: (to be) the location in space of a (relative to other celestial bodies) of a gas-based nebula

stems: (to be) a reflection nebula or dark nebulae (i.e., cloud of dust in space, whether reflecting or blocking light from another source)
(to be) a planetary nebula (i.e., gaseous cloud thrown out by a star at the end of its life) [CPT = supernova remnant nebula]

stems.BSC: (to be) a volume of celestial (i.e., interplanetary, interstellar/intergalactic) space; to be (situated) in space
stems.CTE: (to be) the state/quality of three-dimensional 'spaciousness' or 'room' within a volume of celestial space
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical body/structure/medium of celestial space; to occur or be situated in celestial space
stems.OBJ: (to be) a location in space (relative to celestial bodies within that space)

stems: (to be) a naturally occurring physical material filling or contained within a volume of celestial space (e.g., cosmic dust, plasma or ionized clouds of hydrogen or helium, etc.)
(to be) a magnetic or energy-based field occurring in or contained within a volume of celestial space

stems.BSC: (to be) a black hole
stems.CTE: (to be) a state/quality associated with the unusual physics of a black hole
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical body/mass of a black hole
stems.OBJ: (to be) the location in space of a black hole (relative to other celestial bodies)

stems: (to be) a neutron star (including pulsar and magnetar)

stems.BSC: (to be) an atom
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of an atom in terms of its interaction (or lack thereof) with other atoms; for an atom to interact (via atomic bonding) with other atoms
stems.CSV: (to be) the tangible/physical 'embodiment'/manifestation of an atom
stems.OBJ: (to be) a component/attribute/aspect of an atom (i.e., a particle, a charge, a force, etc.)

stems: (to be) the electron cloud of an atom (i.e., set of electron shells with 'orbiting' electrons) of an atom
(to be) an orbital state (i.e., state and behavior of an electron based on its orbital probability distribution)

stems.BSC: (to be) the nucleus of an atom
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of an atomic nucleus in terms of its interaction (or lack thereof) with other atoms; for an atom to interact (via atomic bonding) with other atoms
stems.CSV: (to be) the tangible/physical 'embodiment'/manifestation of an atomic nucleus
stems.OBJ: (to be) a component/attribute/aspect of an atomic nucleus (i.e., a particle, a charge, a force, etc.)

stems: (to be) a nuclide (i.e., specific configuration of Z- value, N-value, and energy state for a particular atomic nucleus)

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/process of nucleosynthesis resulting in an atomic nucleus
stems.CTE: (to be) state which gives rise to nucleosynthesis
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical process itself of nucleosynthesis
stems.OBJ: (to be) the atomic nucleus resulting from a process of nucleosynthesis

stems.BSC: (to be) a sub-atomic particle
stems.CTE: (to be) the sub-atomic state or 'force' (i.e., interaction) mediated or maintained by a sub- atomic particle
stems.CSV: (to be) the tangible/physical 'embodiment'/manifestation/'stuff' of a sub-atomic particle
stems.OBJ: (to be) an attribute of sub-atomic particle (e.g., mass, charge, spin, angular momentum, etc.)

stems: (to be) an elementary particle (i.e., fermion or boson)
(to be) a composite particle (i.e., a hadron, whether baryon or meson)
acceleron (i.e., hypothetical particle associated with dark energy theory)
sub-atomic particle other than those listed above

stems.BSC: (to be) a mechanical wave; to move/propogate/act as a mechanical wave (e.g., sound, water, seismic, surface, string vibration, etc.) [i.e., propogated oscillations through a medium]
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of oscillation/vibration which makes up a wave
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of generating a wave; to generate a wave
stems.OBJ: (to be) a wave-front, the leading edge of a wave phenomenon

stems: (to be) an electromagnetic or other non-mechanical wave; to move/propogate/act as an electro-magnetic wave (e.g., visible light, radio, ultraviolet, infrared, x-ray, gamma ray, gravitational wave, reaction-diffusion wave, quantum probability wave, etc.)
(to be) a standing wave (e.g., a plucked string of a violin vibrating); to vibrate as a standing wave

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance/occurrence of electricity flowing
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of electrical current flow
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/instance/occurrence of an electrical current or discharge; for electricity to flow or discharge
stems.OBJ: (to be) an object/entity acted upon by electricity

stems: (to be) an act/instance/occurrence of magnetism, magnetic alignment, magnetic force
(to be) a act/instance/occurrence of ionization; to ionize

stems.BSC: (to be) the state/act/process of there being air in a particular spatio-temporal location (i.e., the standard combination of nitrogen/oxygen/argon/CO₂, etc. that constitutes the breathable atmosphere of Earth)
stems.CTE: (to be) air as the primary/relevant component of Earth's (or a planet's) atmosphere
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of obtaining/providing/disseminating air (into a volume of space); to get air, give air, let air in
stems.OBJ: (to be) the air one breathes

stems: (to be) the state/act/process of there being 'fresh' air (i.e., air let in from an external source/outside to replenish the recycled or 'stale' air in a location)

(to be) the state/act/process of there being 'stale' air (i.e., air with a lowered oxygen content and/or higher CO₂ concentration and/or pollutants due to breathing in an enclosed space, air pollution, etc.)

stems.BSC: (to be) the state/act of being/occurring/manifesting outdoors, in the open air, outside; to be/occur/manifest outdoors, be/take place in the open air
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being in an outdoor, open-air setting
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act/process of making/letting something happen outdoors
stems.OBJ: (to be) the outdoors, the open air, outside (as a location/setting/environment for something to be or take place in)

stems: (to be) the state/act/process of being/occurring/manifesting indoors/inside, within the enclosed space(s) of an interior environment separate from the outdoors

(to be) the state/act/process of being/occurring/manifesting in a protected/localized interior/enclosed environment while outdoors (e.g., in a spacesuit on a planetary surface, in a transparent tent outdoors, in a screened-off sun-room of a house, on the screen-enclosed balcony/ledge of a building)

refers: AREA / AREAL FOOTPRINT / PLOT OF GROUND / PLOT OF LAND

stems.BSC: (to be) the quantitative area of a bounded quasi-planar surface, i.e., the amount of square surface space contained within a bounded area (including area expanded by non-level variations in surface gradients); to measure the area of a bounded quasi-planar surface
stems.CTE: (to be) the physical ground/surface of a bounded area
stems.CSV: (to be) the act of measuring/determining the quantitative area of a bounded quasi-planar surface
stems.OBJ: (to be) the actual measured amount of area (i.e., how much acreage/square meters, etc.)

stems: (to be) the quantitative surface-footprint or areal footprint taken up by a quasi-planar surface regardless of non-level variations in surface gradients
(to be) a formal/bounded plot of ground/land based on natural or authorized delineations

stems.BSC: (to be) a terrestial/geographic land feature
stems.CTE: (to be) a particular geographic/terrestrial feature itself
stems.CSV: (to be) the particular aspects/characteristics of a particular type of terrestrial land feature (e.g., the aridness/starkness of a desert, the packed ice/snow of a glacier, the vastness/flatness of a the plains/pampas, etc.)
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of a geographic feature on its surrounding environment

stems: (to be) an area of arable land
(to be) an area of non-arable land

stems.BSC: (to be) a terrestrial land feature of raised elevation in relation to sea level or surrounding flatlands; a hill or mountain
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a hill/mountain
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of dealing with mountainous/elevated terrain; to deal with (e.g., traveling through, living in, etc.) mountainous/elevated terrain
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of mountain on its surrounding environment

stems: (to be) a peak, a single elevated terrestrial upwelling higher than the surrounding the terrain
(to be) a plateau/butte/mesa (i.e., a high/elevated flatland)
notes: [use appropriate affixes to indicate degree of relative elevation]

stems.BSC: (to be) a desert
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a desert
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of dealing with desert terrain; to deal with (e.g., traveling through, living in, etc.) desert terrain
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of a desert on its surrounding environment

stems: (to be) an area of steppe, steppe-like terrain
(to be) an area of tundra, tundra-like terrain

stems.BSC: (to be) a valley
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a valley
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of dealing with a valley as a type of terrain; to deal with (e.g., traveling through, living in, etc.) a valley
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of a valley on its surrounding environment

stems.BSC: (to be) a continent [i.e., raised land mass taking up a significant percentage of a planetary surface, mostly or entirely surrounded by ocean]
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a continent
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of utilizing/living on a continent; to deal with living on a coninent
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of a continent on its surrounding environment

stems.BSC: (to be) an island
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being an island
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of utilizing/living on an island; to deal with living on an island
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of an island on its surrounding environment

stems.BSC: (to be) a volcano
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a volcano
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of with living on or dealing with a volcano
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of a volcano on its surrounding environment

stems.BSC: (to be) a process of forming/becoming an icicle; to form an icicle [CPT = a formed/longstanding icicle]
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being an icicle
stems.CSV: (to be) the process of icicle formation; to physically form an icicle by drop-by-drop accumulation of water in the process of freezing
stems.OBJ: (to be) the geographic/ecological impact of an icicle on its surrounding environment

stems: (to be) a process of forming/becoming a rusticle; to form a rusticle
(to be) a process of forming/becoming a brinicle; to form a brinicle

stems.BSC: (to be) an amount of water; to water, pour/draw/procure some water
stems.CTE: (to be) some water (as a substance)
stems.CSV: (to be) a state/act of drawing/pouring/filling/serving an amount of water; to draw/pour/fill/serve some water
stems.OBJ: (to be) the container, vessel, conveying implement which holds an amount of water

stems: (to be) a natural source of fresh water (e.g., a natural well, river, spring, etc.)
(to be) a a human-made source of fresh water, i.e., a cistern, a reservoir, etc.

refers: WATER IN MOTION OR USE: FLOW / IRRIGATION / CASCADE / WATERFALL

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of water running or flowing; to run/flow [in reference to water or, by analogy, any liquid/fluid with water-like consistency]
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of flowing; to be flowing
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of letting/making flow; to make/let flow
stems.OBJ: (to be) a flow of water [i.e., a particular amount of flowing water]

stems: (to be) state/act of utilizing water, irrigation, watering; to water / irrigate

stems.BSC: (to be) an ocean/sea
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being an ocean/sea
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of utilizing/living by the ocean/sea; to deal with, live by, utilize the ocean/sea
stems.OBJ: (to be) a particular (i.e., named) ocean/sea

refers: WATER CHANNEL BETWEEN LAND MASSES / BAY / INLET

stems.BSC: (to be) a channel-like body of water allowing passage between two land masses
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a channel-like body of water
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of utilizing/living by channel-like body of water; to deal with, live by, utilize a channel-like body of water
stems.OBJ: (to be) a particular (i.e., named) channel-like body of water

stems: (to be) a bay [i.e., body of water partially surrounded by land]
(to be) a narrow river-like inlet (on a body of water)

stems.BSC: (to be) a pond/lake
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a pond/lake
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of utilizing/living by a pond/lake; to deal with, live by, utilize a pond/lake
stems.OBJ: (to be) a particular (i.e., named) pond/lake

refers: ESTUARY / RIVER DELTA / FRESHWATER-SALTWATER TRANSITION ZONE

stems.BSC: (to be) an estuary
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being an estuary
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of utilizing/living by an estuary; to deal with, live by, utilize an estuary
stems.OBJ: (to be) a particular (i.e., named) estuary

stems: (to be) a freshwater-saltwater transition zone (e.g., the mouth of the Amazon or Mississippi Rivers)

refers: SWAMP / MARSH / BOG / FEN / BAYOU / WETLANDS

stems.BSC: (to be) a swamp/marsh
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a swamp/marsh
stems.CSV: (to be) a state of utilizing/living by a swamp/marsh; to deal with, live by, utilize a swamp/marsh
stems.OBJ: (to be) a particular (i.e., named) swamp

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of north-south directional orientation
stems.CTE: (to be) a north-south (i.e., longitudinal) line/path/orientation
stems.CSV: (to be) a state/act of lying upon, traveling upon, or being directed along a north-south, i.e., longitudinal axis
stems.OBJ: (to be) what lies upon or is moving or being directed upon a longitudinal line/axis/path, etc.

stems: (to be) a state/act of being northern or in/of/toward the northern part/area of something in terms of (relative) location/place/origin, etc.
(to be) a state/act of being southern or in/of the southern part/area of something in terms of (relative) location/place/origin, etc.

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of east-west directional orientation
stems.CTE: (to be) an east-west (i.e., latitudinal) line/path/orientation
stems.CSV: (to be) a state/act of lying upon, traveling upon, or being directed along a east- west, i.e., latitudinal axis
stems.OBJ: (to be) what lies upon or is moving or being directed upon a latitudinal line/axis/path, etc.

stems: (to be) a state/act of being eastern or in/of/toward the eastern part/area of something in terms of (relative) location/place/origin, etc.
(to be) a state/act of being western or in/of the western part/area of something in terms of (relative) location/place/origin, etc.

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of being situated or occurring on/at the equatorial line of latitude; be/occur on/at/along the equator
stems.CTE: (to be) the equator
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of situating something or being situated at/on/along the equator; to happen or make happen at/on/along the equator
stems.OBJ: (to be) what is situated or takes place on/at the equator

stems: (to be) a state/act of being situated or occurring on/at the [geographic, not magnetic] north pole
(to be) a state/act of being situated or occurring on/at the [geographic, not magnetic] south pole

stems.BSC: (to be) a particular season (i.e., spring, summer, autumn, winter)
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of it being a certain season; be seasonal
stems.CSV: (to be) a phenomenon occurring during a particular season
stems.OBJ: (to be) a seasonal activity/event/state, i.e., something that happens during a particular season; be something seasonal

stems: (to be) the natural condition or state of growth/dormancy of Nature's flora, as associated with a particular season
(to be) the solstice or equinox associated with a particular season; to be the first day of a season as determined by it being a solstice or equinox

stems.BSC: (to be) Spring, springtime
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of it being springtime
stems.CSV: (to be) a phenomenon/event/state/act occurring during (or because it is) springtime; to occur during (or because it is) springtime
stems.OBJ: (to be) an activity one does/performs during/because it is springtime

stems: (to be) the blooming/flowering/growing phenomenon of Nature's flora occurring/due to it being springtime

stems.BSC: (to be) Summer, summertime
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of it being summertime
stems.CSV: (to be) a phenomenon/event/state/act occurring during (or because it is) summertime; to occur during (or because it is) summertime
stems.OBJ: (to be) an activity one does/performs during/because it is summertime

stems: (to be) the peak state/condition of growth/vibrancy/life of Nature's flora occurring/due to it being summertime

stems.BSC: (to be) Autumn, fall
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of it being autumn
stems.CSV: (to be) a phenomenon/event/state/act occurring during (or because it is) autumn; to occur during (or because it is) autumn
stems.OBJ: (to be) an activity one does/performs during/because it is autumn

stems: (to be) the withering/dying phenomenon of Nature's flora occurring/due to it being autumn

stems.BSC: (to be) Winter, wintertime
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of it being wintertime
stems.CSV: (to be) a phenomenon/event/state/act occurring during (or because it is) wintertime; to occur during (or because it is) wintertime
stems.OBJ: (to be) an activity one does/performs during/because it is wintertime

stems: (to be) the state/condition of dormancy/lifelessness of Nature's flora occurring/due to it being wintertime

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of the ambient outdoor temperature being in a certain range due to the season of the year; to be in a seasonal temperature range
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of it being a certain seasonally-determined temperature
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of determining the ambient temperature range; to see/feel how hot/cold it is outside (based on the expected temperature range of the season)
stems.OBJ: (to be) the ambient temperature (as expected for the season)

stems: (to be) the duration of daylight during a 24-hour period in a location due to the time (i.e., season) of the year
(to be) the angle of the sun (i.e., height of the arc of the sun's passage) due to the time (i.e., season) of the year

stems.BSC: (to be) a weather condition; to be the weather (conditions)
stems.CTE: (to be) the actual extant weather condition at a particular time
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical manifestation(s) of a particular weather condition (e.g., the rain itself, the fog itself, the sunniness itself, the heat itself, the wind itself, etc.)
stems.OBJ: (to be) a party effected/impacted by the weather conditions

stems: (to be) a state of good weather conditions
(to be) a state of adverse weather condition

refers: SKY / ATMOSPHERE / ATMOSPHERIC PHENOMENON / ATMOSPHERIC PRESSURE / CLOUD

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of there being a gaseous atmosphere enveloping a planetary body; to be a planetary atmosphere
stems.CTE: (to be) the collection of gaseous elements which comprise an atmosphere
stems.CSV: (to be) a process/phenomenon of the atmosphere; to manifest an atmospheric phenomenon
stems.OBJ: (to be) the enveloping gaseous, visible (via reflected sunlight) medium of the atmosphere itself, i.e., the sky; to be the sky

stems: (to be) the state/act/process of there being a particular amount of air pressure in the atmosphere; to be a certain atmospheric pressure [i.e., at any given altitude)
(to be) the state/act/process of there being a cloud (in the sky); to be a cloud (in the sky), for a cloud (in the sky) to be present
notes: for 'fog; to be foggy', concatenate Stem 2 of -KTH- ('ground/surface of Earth') in LOCATIVE format into Stem 3 of the above root ('cloud')
Use stem concatenation distinguish combinations such as stratocumulus, cirrocumulus, and cirrostratus, or clouds classed by shape, e.g., nimbus

stems.BSC: (to be) an amount of rainfall; to rain [CPT version = fallen rain, fallen precipitation]
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of rainfall, for rain to be falling
stems.CSV: (to be) a state/act of rain falling
stems.OBJ: (to be) an amount of rainwater (e.g., in a puddle, in a container, in one's hand, etc.)

stems: (to be) an amount of snow; to snow [CPT = fallen snow]
(to be) an amount of hail; to hail [CPT = ice on the ground]
notes: for 'fog; to be foggy', concatenate Stem 2 of -KTH- ('ground/surface of Earth') in LOCATIVE format into Stem 3 of -FTH- ('cloud')

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of there being an air mass/weather front (as differentiated by temperature, water vapor content, and pressure from surrounding air masses)
stems.CTE: (to be) the air mass itself which comprises a weather front
stems.CSV: (to be) a state/process of a weather front affecting the weather of a geographic area
stems.OBJ: (to be) the weather condition caused by a particular weather front

stems: (to be) a state of there being a cold front
(to be) a state of there being a warm front

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of there being a momentary air-pressure-based atmospheric phenomenon, to be a gust of wind, for a gust of wind to blow, for an air current to blow
stems.CTE: (to be) the collection of air (or other gas) reacting to pressure variance which comprise a gust wind
stems.CSV: (to be) a process/phenomenon of a gust of wind blowing; for a gust of wind to blow
stems.OBJ: (to be) the wave-front of a gust of wind (i.e., the concentration of gaseous molecules) which constitutes a (potentially destructive) energetic force which can be felt or which can physically impact objects contacted by the wave front.

stems: (to be) a spirally-oriented storm driven by massive air-pressure variances and Coriolis forces [use appropriate affixes to indicate severity as a tropical depression, hurricane/cyclone/typhoon, tornado, etc.]

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of humid/muggy weather; to be muggy/humid
stems.CTE: (to be) a state/process of ambient heat combined with high humidity that constitutes mugginess
stems.CSV: (to be) a state/process of having to deal with, be exposed to muggy weather conditions
stems.OBJ: (to be) a state of personal discomfort caused by humid/muggy weather

stems: (to be) a state of balmy, calm, clear, pleasant weather; to be balmy, be calm, be clear, be pleasant weather
(to be) a state of crisp/brisk weather; to be crisp/brisk weather

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of there being a lightning strike on something; for lightning to strike something
stems.CTE: (to be) the electrical charge/voltage/amperage/power of a lightning strike
stems.CSV: (to be) a process/phenomenon of a bolt of lightening striking; for a bolt of lightning to strike
stems.OBJ: (to be) a bolt of lightning

stems: (to be) the ionized atmospheric conditions necessary to produce lightning

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of there being a visible rainbow; for there to be a visible rainbow
stems.CTE: (to be) the light passing through aerosolized water vapor that allows a rainbow to be seen
stems.CSV: (to be) the state of seeing a rainbow; to see a rainbow
stems.OBJ: (to be) the atmospheric state of aerosolized water vapor conducive to/needed for seeing a rainbow

stems: (to be) a state of there being a visible aurora
(to be) a state of there being sunlight reflected from interplanetary dust particles visible under certain conditions (e.g., zodiacal light ('false dawn'), gegenschein/counterglow)
